text:
Hi there! Below is a the summary of the work done so far, along with the complete project structure and a detailed breakdown of each file with its content. I need help because I've been trying for weeks to get it working. This is an app with an extension that displays a CRM card containing information from a custom object. I'm sure there are many errors since I'm new to this, so any guidance will be much appreciated.

1. General Project Summary
• *Objective:* Develop a custom application for HubSpot that integrates both a main interface and UI extensions which connect to HubSpot’s APIs and functionalities.
• *Context:* I have been working on this project for several weeks without success. The app includes an extension that displays a CRM card with data from a custom object. As a beginner, I’m facing challenges and would appreciate any help to troubleshoot potential errors.
• *Steps Accomplished:*
    ◦ Established the basic project structure with essential directories and files.
    ◦ Configured the manifest file (manifest.json) to define integration parameters and required permissions.
    ◦ Implemented the main interface within the `src` folder (HTML, JavaScript, and CSS) which handles business logic and connects with HubSpot.
    ◦ Created a UI extension located in the `extensions` folder, complete with its own files for structure, functionality, and styling.
    ◦ Conducted preliminary tests to validate the integration and functionality of both the main application and the extension.
2. Complete Project Structure
```the name of the app and extension is not the real one because is a project for our client 

ExtensionUI/
├── manifest.json
├── package.json
├── src/
│   ├── index.html
│   ├── app.js
│   └── styles.css
└── extensions/
    ├── extension.html
    ├── extension.js
    └── extension.css```
This structure separates the main application (in the `src` folder) from the UI extension (in the `extensions` folder), ensuring a clear organization of the project components.
Thanks for any idea or suggestion to solve this!
